page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES
page.content: By{1925}things had begun to change. There was still a shop but the pubs had closed down because the miners left the area. The schools in Crowan were now closed but a new one had been built in Praze for boys and girls from the age of five to fourteen years. This school is still used today. Crowan still had no mains water, it still came from a spring. There was still no electricity. People cooked on {cornish ranges}and used oil lamps. A few people still did mining but most people were involved in farming. People still travelled in horse and carts and jingles. People took jugs to a farm to get the milk. The village was about the same size as it is now. The mill still worked and the blacksmith was still overworked.
